p: Reconceptualizing the science museum as a hybrid third space strengthens the role of museums as civic and epistemic agents, where audiences are valued co-creators of knowledge. Prioritizing viewpoints and experiences over the “language” of the object (or of science itself) reflects a broader movement where institutions place visitors and their communities (and what they bring) at the centre of their function (Black, 2012). It also allows for a myriad of exhibition practices and spaces that open up powerful and creative opportunities for dialogue, participation, dissent/conflict, and agency.
